multiQuestions.question: Which storage option shares access for multiple users and is comparable to NAS storage (on prem)?
What storage option has items stored by a flat address space and referenced by a unique key
What is the largest size an individual S3 file can be?
Which Storage Tier is good for when the access to the object will be unkown?
Which Storage Tier always puts and keeps objects in the Infrequent Access Tier?
Which Storage Tier has infrequent access and only duplicates objects across one AZ rather than across multiple AZs like the other Storage Tiers?
How long does it take for S3 INT Tier to move Frequent Access Tier to the Infrequent Access Tier?
What are the 3 retrieval options of S3 Glacier, from cheapest to most expensive?
How long can it take to retrieve an item from S3 Glacier using the Expedited retreival option
What does S3 INT stand for?
What does S3 S-IA stand for?
What does S3 Z-IA stand for?
What does S3 G-DA stand for?
For S3 Glacier, buckets are called ___ and objects are called ___
What do Lifecycle Rules do?
multiQuestions.answer: Provide an automatic method of managing the life of your data while it is being stored on S3. Such as moving to another S3 bucket, or deleting the object entirely after a period of time. (For cost saving)

multiQuestions.question: What is Server-Access Logging?
multiQuestions.answer: When enabled, captures and logs requests made to the bucket & its objects and sends them to a Target Bucket as a Log Delivery Group

multiQuestions.question: What is Object-Level Logging?
multiQuestions.answer: When enabled, uses API CloudTrail to track API requests made to objects (PutObject, DeleteObject, etc). Stores it into a Log File which is then stored in S3

multiQuestions.question: What is Transfer Acceleration?
multiQuestions.answer: An S3 setting that when enabled, has requests go to Edge Locations (using CloudFront) to quickly access S3. There is a cost per gigabyte of this featuer whereas regular S3 requests are free

multiQuestions.question: What does CORS (Cross Origin Resource Sharing) do?
multiQuestions.answer: Allows resources on a web page to be requested from a different domain than its own

multiQuestions.question: How do you enable CORS for an S3 Bucket?
multiQuestions.answer: Enable it in the Bucket Policy JSON under the AllowedHeaders property ("*")

multiQuestions.question: Which storage service is best used for uploading a file once, and then reading it many many times?
Which storage service stores and updates data as chunks, and is great for low latency, fast, and persistent storage?
How many storage classes does EFS have?
For EFS, you can move files automatically between Standard and Infrequent Access storage classes by using
What does Max I/O performance mode for EFS do?
multiQuestions.answer: Gives you virutally unlimited throughput to your files, but with higher latency, and is more expensive

multiQuestions.question: What does Provisioned Throughput for EFS do?
multiQuestions.answer: Your file system provisions enough to handle larger burst amounts

booleanQuestions.question: S3 has an object hierarchy
booleanQuestions.popup: You can create folders for organization, but objects are retrieved by a unique key and do not depend on folders or hierarchies

booleanQuestions.question: S3 is highly available, durable, cost effective, widely accessible
By default, S3 data isn't duplicated to multiple AZs in your region
booleanQuestions.popup: Data is duplicated across multiple AZs in your region to increase durability and availabiily (depending on your Storage Class)

booleanQuestions.question: S3 buckets can have any name
booleanQuestions.popup: S3 buckets must have globally unique names

booleanQuestions.question: S3 Versioning is disabled by default
Once S3 Versioning is enabled, it can't be disabled
booleanQuestions.popup: It can only be suspended. All previous versions will still exist

booleanQuestions.question: Server-Access Logging is garaunteed to work for every request to your S3 bucket
booleanQuestions.popup: Not garaunteed, is on a best effort basis

booleanQuestions.question: If 'block all public access' is checked in an S3 bucket, but ACL says to allow public access, public access is allowed through
booleanQuestions.popup: 'block all public access' overrides ACL (and I assume Bucket Policies and IAM)

booleanQuestions.question: For EFS, the Infrequent Access storage class is cheaper than the Standard storage class
booleanQuestions.popup: Infrequent Access is cheaper than Standard, but unlike Standard, it does charge you per every read & write

checkboxQuestions.question: What are the 3 main ways to control access to an S3 bucket?
EFS ...
answers: is a fully managed, highly available and durable service
can easily scale to petabytes in size with low latency access
can maintain a high level of throughput (MB/s)
wrongAnswers: is replicated to multiple AZs in multiple regions
can only be used for one EC2 instance
